DOCNAME: CASE OF MUSTAFA AND ARMAĞAN AKIN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 8;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant 's wife instituted divorce proceedings and asked for the custody of their CARDINAL children ; PERSON ( the second applicant ) and his younger sister PERSON who was born in DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG of First Instance ( “ the ORG ” ) granted the couple 's divorce on DATE . Having regard to the “ parties ' incomes and the ages of the CARDINAL children ” , ORG awarded custody of GPE to the first applicant and that of PERSON to her mother . It also decided that the parents would exchange the children DATE , during DATE and for a total period of DATE during the CARDINAL religious holidays .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant requested ORG to grant an interim measure to the effect that he would have both children DATE and his ex - wife would have them the next . This way , he argued , the children would not lose contact with each other and he would have the opportunity to spend DATE with both his children . This request was rejected on DATE by ORG which considered that its decision concerning the custody issue had been correct .

CARDINAL . The appeal lodged by the applicant against ORG decision of DATE was rejected by ORG on DATE . A request made by the first applicant for a rectification of that decision was rejected on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant brought a court case on behalf of his son and on his own behalf against his ex - wife . He claimed that although he and his son were living in the same town and very close to his ex - wife and his daughter , the decision of ORG had prevented the CARDINAL children from seeing each other and him from spending time with both his children . This , he claimed , was causing irreversible psychological problems for the children . Even when the children saw each other in the street they were prevented from talking to each other by their mother . He requested that the children be able to see each other DATE .
He also asked the court to order his ex - wife to pay maintenance to him in respect of Armağan .

CARDINAL . ORG refused the applicants ' requests on DATE . It held that , although diligence had to be shown to satisfy the needs of the parents and their children and to improve the ties between them , ordering PERSON to spend DATE with her father would mean a continual change of environment for her and would confront her with variations in discipline .

CARDINAL . The applicants appealed and referred in their appeal to a number of decisions of ORG . According to those decisions , the applicable law and procedure required domestic courts to ensure that access arrangements do not prevent the children of divorced parents from seeing each other . The applicants maintained that ensuring this was a matter for a court of law to consider of its own motion . They also argued that the children 's best interests should be given paramount importance . They drew ORG attention to the fact that the CARDINAL siblings had not seen each other for DATE .

CARDINAL . The appeal was rejected by ORG on DATE which considered that ORG had “ adequately examined the evidence available to it and that its conclusion had been in accordance with the applicable legislation ” . A subsequent rectification request lodged by the applicants was rejected on DATE . In their request for rectification the applicants submitted that the CARDINAL children had not seen each other for DATE and that their request for rectification was their last chance of seeing each other .
